title: Quiz 7: Sexually Transmitted Infections (STIs)
topicName: HIV, AIDS and STIs Comprehensive Teaching Manual
description: Evaluate understanding of STI classification, symptoms, diagnosis, and syndromic management.

questions.question: Which organism is the causative agent of Syphilis?
questions.explanation: Syphilis is caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum.

questions.question: Match the STI to its classification:
questions.explanation: Classification based on the causative organism type.
questions.hint: Herpes is a virus; Candida is a fungus.

questions.question: Select the symptoms associated with the 'Genital Ulcer Disease (GUD)' syndrome: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: GUD is characterized by sores or ulcers. Discharge indicates urethritis/vaginitis; warts indicate HPV.
questions.hint: Think about breaks in the skin.

questions.question: Chancroid ulcers are typically painless.
questions.explanation: Chancroid causes PAINFUL ulcers (soft chancre). Syphilis causes painless ulcers (hard chancre).

questions.question: The syndrome 'Urethral Discharge' is commonly caused by Gonorrhea and ___BLANK___.
questions.explanation: Gonorrhea and Chlamydia are the two main causes of urethral discharge treated syndromically.

questions.question: What is the primary treatment for Syphilis?
questions.explanation: Benzathine Penicillin is the standard treatment for Syphilis.

questions.question: Order the stages of Syphilis:
questions.explanation: Syphilis progresses from a local sore -> systemic rash -> latency -> severe organ damage.

questions.question: Which STI presents with a 'heavy, curdy, white' vaginal discharge?
questions.explanation: This description is classic for Candidiasis (Yeast infection).

questions.question: Genital Warts are caused by which virus?
Presence of STIs increases the risk of HIV transmission.
questions.explanation: STIs cause inflammation or breaks in the skin/mucosa, significantly increasing HIV risk.
questions.hint: They facilitate entry of the virus.
